fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38163].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Create a user
# Create an issue and assign it to the user created
# Navigate to _Administration > User Namangement_ and change the username for the user
# Go back to the issue created, and reassign it to another user and then assign it to the same user created earlier 

*Expected Results*:
The Issue *History* tab will show the new username of the user

*Actual Results*:
The issue *History* tab shows the old username before the rename of the user. Even though the full name is changed as expected, however the username is no changed.
fields.summary: Old username still shows in issue history after renameing a user.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38162].
  {panel}

When a user wants to add a field to their Filter Results gadget, they need to do the following:

# Click "Edit" in the gadget's config menu.
# Pick the field from the drop-down.
# Click "Add".
# Click "Save".

At least 5 times in the past week I've accidentally skipped step 3 and then wondered why the field wasn't added.

I was the person who originally wrote this UI and it seems it isn't even intuitive to me :(

The reason the "add" button was included in the first place (rather than adding the field automatically when an item is selected) was to make the feature keyboard-navigable in all browsers.

I think the best solution is, if you click "Save" and there's a field selected in the dropdown but not added yet; either:
* Prompt the user with a dirty form warning, or
* Automatically add the field.

!FilterResultsAdd.png!
fields.summary: It's too easy to mess up adding a field / column to the Filter Results gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38156].
  {panel}

At the moment, it's not possible to select a subset of issues from the search, and then perform a bulk operation on those issues. A user must adjust their JQL search and then run the bulk update on the results, similar to how this is done in the Gmail interface.
 
For Example:
There is a filter which is a list of issues created over the last 3 days, from the summary the User can then select similar issues and assign them to a single person directly.

Similarly, you can in this way bulk close, assign or apply labels to these issues. This is extremely helpful for any workflow where a daily triage is necessary.
fields.summary: As a Project Manager, I want to be able to select multiple issues from a search result, and perform issue operations on them
Ability to quickly add new version or component through issue create screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38153].
  {panel}

When pages from a linked Confluence site (added using Application Links) are added as "Issue Links" to JIRA, if the page link contains a link to a section in the page as a HTML anchor (for example, http://confluence:8080/display/myspace/Page#Page-Section), then the anchors should also be displayed.

*Notes*
* It is possible to add links using anchors using the REST remote API interface.
* Links to other sites as well as unauthenticated Confluence links show anchors, so it seems to be restriction for authenticated Confluence links
fields.summary: Support for section anchors in issue link to authenticated Confluence pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38150].
  {panel}

I wrote up ticket
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-37971

And was then told basically that I should go file the bug again in another system for support.

Which I did by making https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/jsp/configuration-query-192037

This is not a user friendly approach
1) It assumes the user has perfect pre-existing ability to determine what kind of issue should belong in what kind of system
2) It requires the user spending time to report the same issue twice.

There should be some way for JIRA themselves to "move" a ticket like https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/jsp/configuration-query-192037 into the support systems themselves. Enable that process for the end user don't make the end user jump through more hoops because the complexity of the system itself by which users deliver feedback is multifarious and confusing.
fields.summary: Some feature where JIRA admins can "move" tickets created in JIRA to support structure

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38143].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian,

When I select a filter to display on our wiki page on confluence it will pop-up automatically with the help of the Jira Macro. In the display options there is the "Attachment"  column. 

It will be nice if the Attachments from the Drag and drop plug-in of Jira will show as a link or something in confluence with the use of the Macro. But when i select the column I don't see anything. If there is a attachment inside a jira issue which is inside the filter, the attachment field stays blank.

It's strange that the drag and drop system in Jira makes the file list under the heading " AttachmentS ", while in Confluence the column name is " Attachment ".

How can i solve this problem?

Friendly Regards,

Total Company
fields.summary: Jira Macro column Attachment

I'm trying to configure a JIRA plug-in called Behaviors to calculate a field by using data from two other fields. So far I've had no luck with the configuration or online help.

https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/jira/6.0.5/reference/classes.html

Would it be possible to get more guidance here?

Thanks

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. In Inquiry workflow, try to Add Transition ("Reopen") from Closed to Open state.
2. The Add Transition link is not available in the Inquiry Workflow, Text screen (See attached Cannot Add Transition from Closed to Open 1.png)
3. Go to Inquiry Workflow, Diagram screen and press Add Transition.  This fails with error "You cannot perform this operation on a draft workflow" (See attached Cannot Add Transition from Closed to Open 2.png)

JIRA should allow adding transitions out of the Closed state.  This worked last year and is a recently introduced bug.

The same bug was mentioned in the comments forum on this page on March 26, 2014: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Workflow#ConfiguringWorkflow-Limitationswheneditinganactiveworkflow
fields.summary: Cannot Add Transition from Closed to Open

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38136].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a JIRA Instance has many Security Levels the performance of JIRA can degrade significantly.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an environment with many Projects and Issue Security Configuration.
# Observe a degradation of performance on the instance.
# Thread dumps from an affected JIRA instance may indicate many threads showing a stack traces involving IssueSecurity.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should remain performant and cope with the scale in issues or issue security.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA becomes unresponsive with large numbers of issue security levels configured.

h3. Notes
[Configuring Issue level Security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue-level+Security] currently indicates thar setting more than 10 issue security levels can impact performance in JIRA.

h3. Workaround
# Run the following SQL to check the number of security level:
{code}
select scheme, count(security) from schemeissuesecurities group by scheme;
scheme | count
--------+-------
  10000 |  1279
  10030 |    3
  ...
(7 rows){code}
# Reduce the issue security levels. 
# Reduce the number of groups using in each level.
fields.summary: JIRA performance degrades when a large number of security levels are used

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38135].
  {panel}

Currently, if administrator wants to "clone" a user directory, a new directory need to be created using the same or similar set of configuration. Administrator might want to "clone" the directory because:
* administrator would need to create multiple directories connecting to the same LDAP server to limit the amount of users retrieved for each directory while avoiding complex users/groups filter
* group membership is done locally and creating a new directory will require administrator to associate users to groups
* testing new configurations or parameter without updating the current working directory to allow easy "roll back" by changing the directory sequence
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to copy existing User Directory

When a user is an assignable user according to the project's permission scheme, but the user is not able to see it due to the security level set for the issue, the issue can get assigned to the user.

Request
Can the available users to assign an issue to be checked based on the security level settings of the issue
or
Can a warning get displayed when an issue gets assigned to a user who is assignable user, but does not have the proper security level to see it?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38125].
  {panel}

One common total crash for JIRA is when it does run out of database connection. 

Any reliable web application should be able to resist to a peak in number of request and not to fully crash when this happens. 

This is also a security issue because it means that anyone could easily bring the server down just by issuing requests to it.

The correct behavior is to stop processing new requests when this happens and to respond with HTTP 503, also logging an ERROR.
fields.summary: prevent crashing when running out of database connections

fields.description:
We are upgrading a JIRA 5.2.7 instance to version 6.2.3.  The 64-bit installer completed without error, but one warning regarding manual changes to the server.xml file.  No SQL server connection information is in the server.xml file.

After restarting JIRA the following error was displayed when accessing JIRA from a browser:

JIRA Startup Failed
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT pluginkey, pluginenabled FROM jira.pluginstate (Invalid object name 'jira.pluginstate'.) 

The back end database is SQL Server 2012,  JIRA is running on a Windows 2008 R2 server.  

On checking the JIRA database on the server I can confirm that there is no jira.pluginstate table.  There is a jira.pluginversion table, but it does not have a pluginenabled column.
fields.summary: JIRA Startup Failed - Invalid object name 'jira.pluginstate'

  {panel}

We have two options when creating Crucible review in Jira:
1. Create review for selected commits
2. Create review for all commits

Sometimes it would be useful if we could:
- create review for all unreviewd commits (all commits which don't have attached review) - now we have to add review for one of the commit and then add other commits in Crucible to created review
- add all unreviewed commits to existing review - I know there can be more than one existing review, but f.e. add to latest one

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38117].
  {panel}

We have a JIRA workflow with the following:
- Upon creation, tickets enter the "Triage" state.
- There is a transition called "Assign" that transitions it to the "Assigned" state.
- This "Assign" transition is tied to a custom screen where the Assignee, Priority, etc can be set.

Due to the built in "Assign" button and "Assign to Me" link, it is possible for developers to use these to assign issues to others or themselves without actually setting priority and transitioning the issue to the Assigned state. If they notice this, they can then use the correct "Assign" button (for our workflow transition) to advance state and set priority, however this results in two emails being sent to the Reporter for the same action. If they don't notice this, the issue is in the wrong state and may be lost (for example, if a user has a filter set up to show issues in the "Assigned" state and the "Assignee" is them, it will not show these tickets because the ticket is still in the "Triage" state).

I would like to propose the ability to remove the Assign button and related items like the "Assign to Me" link.
fields.summary: Ability to remove "Assign" button from issue header bar and "Assign to Me" links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38109].
  {panel}

I have experienced that it is sometimes quite troublesome to prioritise issues. Different people find their own issues more important than others and claim priority over others. How can I 'score' my issues objectively?

I would really like a calculator to compute business value based upon a number of questions like "Are there many users/customers involved?". Yes? then add 100 points, No? No points.
"Does my company suffer financial damage?" Yes? 250 points, No? No points
"Is it easy to fix?" Yes? 50 points, No? No points
"Is the issue law- or policy based?" Yes? 150 points, No? No points etc. etc.

The sum of all these criteria result in my business value. Of course I can always add a (less objective score) number of points if my managers really want an issue ranked higher on the list...

I currently use an Excel sheet to do this for me, but it would be nice if I could manage the criteria and the scores in each seperate project. Then (adding a new issue) I call up the calculator, answer the yes/no questions and click [adopt business value to issue].

I hope more users like this idea.

Kind regards!
fields.summary: Business Value 'Calculator'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38106].
  {panel}

I've run into an issue where by using the API to update/delete worklogs, that the sum of the individual worklogs no longer equals the time spent field.

it can be hard to reproduce, updating works most of the time, but if enough updates are made, the issue does come up.

Most easily reproducible is deleting worklogs, after deleting them the time spent is not updated at all, I have tickets where there are NO worklog entries, but still have time allocated in time spent. Screenshot attached.

I can not reproduce this using the UI, only the API.

Original support request- JST-92340
fields.summary: Individual Worklog entries in Jira issue, don't sum up to the total time spent field

fields.description:
like CONF-23957 - if you use the sso connector to crowd the users credentials are NOT copied to local cache in JIRA.
The user is created in crowd from delegated ldap but not copied to local cache.
The result is that the user sees: "username or password are incorrect" since the user is synced to local cache.

This behaviour is different from the "normal" authenticator that indeed copies the credentials.
fields.summary: JIRA SSO authenticator class does not copy users on login
Invalid link on JIRA documentation page
Rendering of bullet points has different indentation during Preview of a wiki-renderable field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38090].
  {panel}

Apparently, if you have HTML configured as default notification, and you're going to use the send mail functionality to send a notification to your users, and specify the notification to be "Text", the mail will be sent as text, but will keep all the HTML tags from the default configuration.
This is not the expected behavior indeed, the notification should be sent as text and not leaving the html tags.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Configure the Outgoing mail.
# Browse to Administration >> User Management >> Change the default Notifications to "HTML"
# Browse to System >> Send mail.
# Send an email to a Group/role, and send as "Text"
# The email will be sent showing the HTML tags of the default notification.

h3. Expected Behavior:

The notification should be converted to plain text, removing the HTML tags.
fields.summary: Send email as text shows the HTML tags.

fields.description:
Hi there, 

We have just signed up to Jira on demand and I am in the process of customising it as best as I can, however, when I go to the "more" tab when in an issue, It comes up with GLIFFY IS UNLICENSED.

Can you please tell me how I can remove this?

Cheers!
fields.summary: Want to remove "Gliffy" from the drop down menu under the "more" tab

fields.description:
1) Create custom fields using the Multi User Picker and User Picker.
2) Navigate to the specific workflow step.
3) Navigate to Validators.
4) Add the custom fields as required field as a validator.

Upon performing the workflow action specified, the user isn't prompted to enter a user and the action completes.

The more specific example: We'd like to notify the developer once we close an issue. So I've created a "Notify" field using both Multi User Picker and User Picker and placed that as the last step of our workflow (Close Issue). On that step transition, I've set up a validator to make that field required (only during that step) but if the field is left empty, JIRA doesn't indicate the field is required. Is there a fix for this issue?
fields.summary: Unable to make the custom fields "Multi User Picker" and "User Picker" required via the validator.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38077].
  {panel}

We have recently upgraded to JIRA 6.2.3 (from JIRA 5.1) and so all our original status images have since changed to the colour lozenges.

Broadly, this is a nice change, however there are too few lozenge colours available to meet all our different states.

We desperately need the ability to set different lozenge colours across multiple projects - for instance, we run test case management through JIRA, there are two 'end' states, 'Passed' or 'Failed', at the moment these are both green which makes it harder to rapidly spot the failed ones in a list and is a definite visual regression.

Even if the lozenges were just expanded to include the Atlassian standard ones this would be a great help! :

https://developer.atlassian.com/design/latest/communicators/lozenges/
fields.summary: Ability to customize/expand status lozenges colour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38074].
  {panel}

* participants = author, assignee, commenter, watcher, etc 

Ideally, the autocomplete for the @mention dialog would search these on the client first, and then go to the server for more if needed.

In the most common case for when I mention someone on a JIRA issue, that user is already a participant (has mentioned me in a previous comment etc), so its frustrating having to wait 10s of seconds for the autocomplete to return.

This is especially needed on large enterprise instances such as our very own support.atlassian.com
fields.summary: When searching for users to @Mention prioritise users who are participants in the issue already
Fix the Agile board

fields.description:
Hey guys,

Just started using JIRA and Fisheye, and I'm seeing this issue on both. We use a novell, and decided to use LDAP in order to allow users to login using their credentials. But, we've been running across issues. I've logged in several times with my credentials and somehow logged in with someone else's account. Although, I still have administration rights and it doesn't seem to move it to the users I log into. Another user who is also an admin is having the same issue herself, in which she logs in with my ID somehow. Also, we have testrail and integrated JIRA. When we push a ticket to our JIRA site, it'll have the issue come up then so sometimes it'll post the ticket with different user IDs than what it's supposed to be doing. 

I've tried re-adding the LDAP settings to make sure I'm doing it right, but this issue has become a daily issue.

We are using JIRA v6.2.2 and SuSE Enterprise Server 11 SP2 (using VMWare)

Please assist! Thanks!
fields.summary: LDAP issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38066].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate:*

1. Export any OnDemand JIRA instance
2. Import that into an Oracle DB backed JIRA BTF/Download

*More information*

Seeing this in OnDemand -> BTF exports from PostgreSQL to Oracle databases.

Here's the table definition in Oracle for jquartz_simple_triggers:
{noformat}
 CREATE TABLE JQUARTZ_SIMPLE_TRIGGERS
(
  SCHED_NAME       VARCHAR2(120 BYTE),
  TRIGGER_NAME     VARCHAR2(200 BYTE)           NOT NULL,
  TRIGGER_GROUP    VARCHAR2(200 BYTE)           NOT NULL,
  REPEAT_COUNT     NUMBER(13),
  REPEAT_INTERVAL  NUMBER(13),
  TIMES_TRIGGERED  NUMBER(13)
)
TABLESPACE JIRA_DATA
RESULT_CACHE (MODE DEFAULT)
PCTUSED    0
PCTFREE    10
INITRANS   1
MAXTRANS   255
STORAGE    (
            INITIAL          64K
            NEXT             1M
            MAXSIZE          UNLIMITED
            MINEXTENTS       1
            MAXEXTENTS       UNLIMITED
            PCTINCREASE      0
            BUFFER_POOL      DEFAULT
            FLASH_CACHE      DEFAULT
            CELL_FLASH_CACHE DEFAULT
           )
LOGGING
NOCOMPRESS
NOCACHE
NOPARALLEL
MONITORING;
{noformat}

However here's the table defintion in PostgreSQL:
{noformat}
jira=> \d jquartz_simple_triggers;
        Table "public.jquartz_simple_triggers"
     Column      |          Type          | Modifiers 
-----------------+------------------------+-----------
 sched_name      | character varying(120) | 
 trigger_name    | character varying(200) | not null
 trigger_group   | character varying(200) | not null
 repeat_count    | numeric(18,0)          | 
 repeat_interval | numeric(18,0)          | 
 times_triggered | numeric(18,0)          | 
Indexes:
    "pk_jquartz_simple_triggers" PRIMARY KEY, btree (trigger_name, trigger_group)
{noformat}

Looking at the entity definitions:
{noformat}
/opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/entitydefs# grep -A 6 JQRTZSimpleTriggers entitymodel.xml
    <entity entity-name="JQRTZSimpleTriggers" table-name="JQUARTZ_SIMPLE_TRIGGERS" package-name="">
        <field name="schedName" col-name="SCHED_NAME" type="quartz-char-120"/>
        <field name="triggerName" col-name="TRIGGER_NAME" type="quartz-char-200"/>
        <field name="triggerGroup" col-name="TRIGGER_GROUP" type="quartz-char-200"/>
        <field name="repeatCount" col-name="REPEAT_COUNT" type="quartz-long-int"/>
        <field name="repeatInterval" col-name="REPEAT_INTERVAL" type="quartz-long-int"/>
        <field name="timesTriggered" col-name="TIMES_TRIGGERED" type="quartz-long-int"/>
{noformat}

In any case, because the column is shorter in Oracle than it is in PostgreSQL import failures occur when migrating from OnDemand to BTF if Oracle is utilized.

*To workaround this issue, modify the column lengths of the jquartz_simple_triggers and jqaurtz_triggers from numeric 13 to numeric 18*
fields.summary: Inconsistent column length in database tables for jquartz_simple_triggers and jquartz_triggers

fields.description: This subtask has 100 characters in its summary

Hi Jira,

I am writing to report a 'bug' on the 'auto assignee' problem. Although we already set up the way you instructed, which is below, the tickets are still auto assigned to one of our guys. And for some reasons, that guy actually has two names appearing in the system under the same email address.I feel this could be a problem and cause unnecessary redundancy and inconsistency to our ticketing system. 

Below is the answer you gave us before, we did exactly what you told us to. But the problem is still happening.

This is actually configured in the Administration » Projects » 'Your Project' » Roles (tab) screen - you can see in the top a Default Assignee option, which you can select "Unassigned". Just make sure the Allow unassigned issues flag is turned on in the General Configuration settings in JIRA.

I understand this is not the first time we get to you on this issue and please forgive for all those troubles. 

Feel free to call at 6463804320 for further questions or details. 

Regards,
Gabrielle Yang | Jr. Linux System Administrator | eXelate

7 West 22nd Street, 9th Floor, New York, NY 10010
fields.summary: auto assignee problem

Before we upgraded from JIRA 5.2.7 to 6.1.7, we could click on the Agile or Structure Top Menu item and it would take you to lass accessed Board or Structure. Now, it forces you to select from the dropdown. I have to tell you, moving to this new version of JIRA has taken a lot of functionality away that we use to have before. 

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-190798	when you click on the Source tab, you can't see the programs modified and there's no down arrow symbol to download the entire program 
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-37977	When clicking Create Another when creating a JIRA ticket, the description from the ticket just created doesn't pre populate in the new ticket
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-35186	dropdown fields no longer allow access to the last list items
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36109	Make Permalink copy to clipboard

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38040].
  {panel}

In previous versions of JIRA (prior to 6.2) you could see a list of issues for each version on the roadmap as described in the documentation:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA062/Browsing+a+Project%27s+Road+Map

It seems this behavior changed in 6.2 (can see the new behavior here https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA?selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:roadmap-panel&allVersions=true). In the page source code I can still see the code to allow it to expand which has a link to expand per version but it is hidden.

I also don't see any mention of the change in the release notes:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+6.2+Release+Notes

Could we confirm this was intended behavior get the docs updated and/or provide a fix. We have an issue raised in support and also several users have commented on the docs here:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Browsing+a+Project's+Road+Map
fields.summary: Jira roadmap behavior has changed

We have not found a direct way in JIRA to extract the following one-to-many relationships in which the Enhancement issue type is the parent (JIRA has a field called “Linked Issues” but only provides the list of issue numbers and no information about their type):

- Associated Test Cases
- Associated Tasks/Sub-Tasks

Also, timesheet reports available through the Dashboard are limited to a maximum of 2 months’ time span, so we can't do historical project reporting.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38033].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

In LookupAliasActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl() the ActionConfiguration is cached in the private map actionAliases. There are good reasons to do that since ActionConfiguration.getActionCommand() causes a lot of requests to Configuration.get()

Though in the same thread JiraWebworkViewDispatcher.getActionConfiguration() ActionConfiguration.getActionCommand() is called again later which makes the caching less useful. JiraWebworkViewDispatcher should also call the caching code within method LookupAliasActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl(). One could factor out the the caching code into a separate module and inject it in all places where ActionConfiguration is needed.

I have checked the source for 6.2.3 but likely earlier version also show this behaviour.

This is easy to fix and should make it's way into at least 6.3.x. My tests showed that the overall response time when calling a webwork action drops from 300 to 250 ms.  

Regards,
Dieter
fields.summary: JiraWebworkViewDispatcher uses noncaching method getActionConfiguration which causes peformance degradation when webwork actions are called
Documentation for "save on blur" needs update.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38026].
  {panel}

Our use of JIRA Agile onDemand consists of a strict association of 1 issue to 1 sprint. We use a single main board called 'Release' and we release software weekly, which is also the Sprint cadence.

Recent changes to the Sprint ID, made it such that an issue can no longer assigned to a completed sprint or removed from a completed sprint. Only active and future sprints can be selected when editing the Sprint ID.

In this specific case, I have single issue which was initially closed 1 or more weeks back, hence assigned to a now completed sprint. The issue has now been reopened and I need to update the Sprint from the old to the current open sprint. However, I cannot do that and I am only allowed to add the new sprint, not replace it to the old completed sprint. In the past this was entirely possible.

It would be advisable to allow this based on a configuration parameter or permit the change only to a select group of people (e.g. administrators).
fields.summary: Ability to remove an issue from a completed sprint or assign it to a completed sprint

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38009].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

Currently if you add an user as a watcher to an issue which he doesn't have "Browse Project" permission, he won't be able to receive notifications.

h3. Expected behaviour

Allow the watcher permission to work independently of the browse project permission so an user added as a watcher receives the notification even if he doesn't receive the browse project permission.

This can be useful for users who want to grant access for one ticket specifically, but not all of the tickets in the project.
fields.summary: Allow the user to be a watcher of an issue without having the browse project permission

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-38007].
  {panel}

Hi,

We have added an HTML button (called Validar) using JavaScript code injection in the description of the field.

It has been detected than first time that the form loads the button appears correctly. However, if a reload of the form is needed (i.e.: a change in the type of issue), the form does not show the button any more.

The described behaviour can be seen in the attacched video: Custom_button_does_not_render_properly.mp4

Inspecting HTML generated code for the form it seems that the problem is that in second and subsequent reloads the JavaScript code in the description of the field is not been applied and therefore the HTML code of the button is not generated. 

Could you please give a look to this behaviour? Thanks in advance.

Regards.
fields.summary: Custom JavaScript-injected button does not render properly when reloading form

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-37996].
  {panel}

Due to  how JIRA is build, schema updates can happen any time when the instance is up and running especially for plugins, including third party plugins operation.

This made specific database configuration where JIRA can only use regular account that unable to updates database schema not possible.

In order to workaround this, JIRA should provide a feature that could delay all schema updates and trigger at the same time when the administrator prefer.

In regards to plugin installation process, JIRA could mark this plugin as inactive until all the necessary process to complete its installation are triggered at the same time as the other schema updates process.

*Possible Implementation*

A new queue menu under JIRA administrators could be implemented for this feature. Like Mail Queue menu, administrators have the privilege to see the pending task that need to be run and administrator can choose which task to run individually or the whole queue at the same time
fields.summary: Delay All Schema Updates and Trigger it at The Same Time

We have 1 JIRA Agile system and multi Confluence instances. Application links etc. works fine, but as noted in your documentation:

Your JIRA instance must be linked to your Confluence site, and your JIRA project must be linked to a Confluence space. See Linking to Another Application (JIRA documentation). If you have JIRA linked to multiple Confluence sites, the primary link will be used for the features described on this page. 

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+JIRA+Agile+and+Confluence+together

In an issue you can select other instances very easily and connect to the correct pages. 

Can you please introduce this feature also to the create pages in multiple Confluence instances?
Then we really can create meeting notes on the fly, wrap up a sprint with a retrospective report, and more.
